title: Discussing Work and Career
description: Practice discussing professional situations, making speculations, and giving opinions about workplace issues.

sentences.text: She must be preparing for her promotion interview. She's been staying late every day.
sentences.translation: 그녀는 분명 승진 면접을 준비하고 있을 거야. 매일 야근하고 있거든.
sentences.tips: 'must be + -ing'로 현재 진행 중인 일에 대한 확신을 표현하세요.

sentences.text: He can't be serious about turning down the job offer. The salary was excellent.
sentences.translation: 그가 그 일자리 제안을 거절하겠다는 게 진심일 리 없어. 연봉이 정말 좋았는데.

sentences.text: The meeting might have been rescheduled. I haven't received a reminder.
sentences.translation: 회의가 일정이 변경되었을 수도 있어. 알림을 못 받았거든.

sentences.text: They must have had a good reason for the sudden restructuring.
sentences.translation: 그들이 갑작스러운 구조조정을 한 데는 분명 타당한 이유가 있었을 거야.
sentences.tips: 'must have + 과거분사'로 과거에 대한 확신을 표현하세요.

sentences.text: The project deadline could be extended if we explain the technical difficulties.
sentences.translation: 기술적 어려움을 설명하면 프로젝트 마감이 연장될 수도 있어.

sentences.text: She should be feeling confident about the interview. She's extremely qualified.
sentences.translation: 그녀는 면접에 대해 자신감을 가져야 해. 자격이 충분하니까.

sentences.text: He may not have understood the new policy correctly. Let me explain it again.
sentences.translation: 그가 새 정책을 제대로 이해하지 못했을 수도 있어. 다시 설명해 줄게.
sentences.tips: 'may not have'로 과거의 부정적 가능성을 표현하세요.

sentences.text: The company could be planning to open a new branch. That would explain all the hiring.
sentences.translation: 회사가 새 지점을 열 계획일 수도 있어. 그게 모든 채용을 설명해 주겠네.
sentences.tips: 'could be + -ing'로 현재 진행 중일 수 있는 계획을 추측하세요.

sentences.text: They can't have finished the audit already. It usually takes at least a month.
sentences.translation: 그들이 벌써 감사를 끝냈을 리 없어. 보통 최소 한 달은 걸리거든.

sentences.text: The manager must have approved the budget. Otherwise, we couldn't have started.
sentences.translation: 매니저가 예산을 승인했음에 틀림없어. 그렇지 않으면 시작할 수 없었을 테니까.
sentences.tips: 'must have'와 'couldn't have'를 조합하여 논리적 추론을 표현하세요.

sentences.text: She might be considering early retirement. She's been talking about traveling more.
sentences.translation: 그녀가 조기 퇴직을 고려하고 있을지도 몰라. 여행을 더 많이 하고 싶다고 말했거든.
sentences.tips: 'might be + -ing'로 진행 중일 수 있는 일을 추측하세요.

sentences.text: He should have negotiated a higher salary when he had the chance.
sentences.translation: 그는 기회가 있었을 때 더 높은 연봉을 협상했어야 했어.
sentences.tips: 'should have + 과거분사'로 과거에 하지 않은 일에 대한 조언을 표현하세요.

lines.text: Did you hear that Lisa is leaving the company? She must have found something better.
Really? She can't be leaving! She just got promoted six months ago.
I know, it's surprising. She might be joining a startup. She's always talked about wanting to work somewhere more innovative.
That could be a risky move. Startups don't always succeed.
True, but she must have weighed the pros and cons carefully. She's not the type to make impulsive decisions.
I suppose so. It makes me think about my own career. I might be missing opportunities by staying here too long.
Have you considered looking elsewhere? You should be earning more with your experience.
I've thought about it. The market could be good right now for people with our skills.
Exactly. You might want to update your CV just in case. It never hurts to see what's out there.
You're right. I should have done that months ago. I guess Lisa's news was the wake-up call I needed.

items: Did you pronounce modal verbs clearly (must, might, could, should)?
Did you use appropriate stress on key words?
Did you link words naturally in connected speech?
Did you use rising intonation for uncertainty appropriately?
Did you use modal verbs for speculation smoothly?
Did you transition naturally between certainty and possibility?
Did you complete sentences without long pauses?
Did you participate naturally in the dialogue?
Did you use 'must be/can't be' for present deductions correctly?
Did you use 'must have/can't have' for past deductions correctly?
Did you use 'might/could/may' for possibility appropriately?
Did you use 'should/ought to' for expectations correctly?
Did you express speculation and uncertainty clearly?
Did you use appropriate professional vocabulary?
Did you support your speculations with reasons?
Did you engage naturally in discussing workplace topics?
